addressleaf.section:
[.]
made to the
Stat
[of]
Holland
to Ay
de the
Queene
for Raysyng the winynge of the Towne of
Breste
in
Bryttany
at the Instance of the
Kinge of Fraunce
.
July 1594 36 Eli
z

page.lettertext:
fol.217r
S
r
Thomas Bodley to the Lord Tresorer the 21 July
is
1594
.
Maye it please yo
r
good lordshipe as soone as I had sealed my former unto yo
w
uppon a Newe advertyssmente sente hether from
M
r
Caron
, to the
stat
theare weare
Certen deputed to Confere agayne w
th
me, and to learne what I Could sygnefye
as touchinge thes demaund
w
ch
weare mad by hir Ma
tie
and proposed to
M
r
Caron the 15 of this monthe in yo
r
lordshipes house in
London
but declaring
unto them that I had Not understood the
tyculer poynt
, they im
ted them unto me
and sygnefyed w
th
all that for 9 or 10 shipes for 3 monthes Required by hir Ma
tie
they did Not thinke that the Contreye wold make any dyffycoltye, Nor for the 20
thousand weighte of Poudere but they Could Not Comprehend, what was ment
by that poynte, whearin hir Ma
tie
dothe desyre to be served of two monthes victu-
elles for ij thousand mene, for they doe presume that all kynd of victuelles are
moare aboundante, and bettere Cheape and more Redye for that service in
England
then heare, and that they Cannot and that they Cannot well Carrye for mores
then 3 monthes victuelles / Agayne they seemed to
Amaze
Marvell, that yf it
weare intended that the forte befoare breste shold be taken from the Ennemye
theare was No menc
o
n of munyc
o
n, and that for pouder so small a quantety
was demaunded, for that in thes Contreyes theye doe make provissyone at the
leaste at the seege of any place that is of importance of two hondrethe
weighte
thousand weighte, and of fyfty thousand onely to serve
from
for these
small shote, I Could Not tell what to Answere to any of thes doubt
bycause
I had Receaved No Comyssyone about it Nor was Not easely to Conjecture at
hir Ma
t
meaninge, howbeit
ceavinge by their speeches that they wold Not shrinke
in any poynte but weare Rather inclyned to afford a greatere proporsyon of every
thinge demaunded then was mentioned by hir Ma
tie
, I solysseted them in that be-
halfe, declarynge for the Rest that I thoughte thes demaund
weare onely made
by waye of Communycation and proceeded of an unperfect projecte caste uppon
the meetynge onely, and that they shold be thoroughely satysfyed when I had
my letteres, w
ch
I Expected every howere, whearuppon they Concluded that for
the reasones alledged at the tyme of my Audyence (w
ch
I have sette doune in
my former to yo
r
lordshipe) and because M
r
Caron the very same daye that he
had speeche w
th
hir Ma
tie
in yo
r
lordshipes house Receaved after a letter from
S
r
Robarte Secill
whearin he was Requested in hir highenes Name to staye his
dispache beccause shee had Not yet taken a full Resolusyon, but presently up
o
Notys of hir determynate fynall purpos, w
th
some 16 or 20 dayes warninge
they wold be Redye w
th
their Navye and
and
all thing
appertaynynge,
And thus
I take my humble leave from the Haghe July 21 1594.
Yo
r
Lordshipes moste humble att Comaundemente Tho: Bodley
